ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Pets vs. Familiars
ygData.msgSnippet: It s also the first spell of that type a wizard gets so it fizzles a LOT. My wizard spent a good 3 hours medding and fizzling just trying to get her familiar
ygData.messageBody:
It's also the first spell of that type a wizard gets so it fizzles a LOT. My
wizard spent a good 3 hours medding and fizzling just trying to get her
familiar back. I've never noticed any change in my fizzles or anything after
a successful summoning. And sometimes it runs off and I can't find it. But
it's fun to have it just following around and flapping it's little wings.
When I'm bored I just talk to my familiar and emote I'm feeding it cookies.
Too bad you can't name your familiars. I call mine Flappy.
luv,
-Su


Familiar is a wizard's pet. It can't fight, it's more like a visible buff.
You have to resummon it each time you die, but it zones with you.
----- Original Message -----
From: Steven R. Hulse
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, July 19, 2002 2:09 PM
Subject: [EverQuest] Pets vs. Familiars


I've noticed lately there are now "Familiars" that people have. How do
these differ from Pets? Also when you die and have a "familiar" do you
have to reconjure them up like you do a pet or do they come back when
you do? And finally who all can have a "familiar"?

Thanks!
